Learn more how customers reviews work on Amazon View Image Gallery Amazon Customer 3.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound. Confusing controls Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022 I was looking for a relatively inexpensive dynamic mic with hardware mute and gain controls with a nice rich Podcast/Radio sound to it. This mic definitely delivered the later. Gain seems good and the sound quality was pretty much spot on to what I was looking for. The controls however...BE AWARE: Despite what the icons on the side of the mic would suggest, the up/down buttons control system volume, ostensibly for controlling the volume for the built in monitor jack, and worse, despite the icon of a crossed out microphone, the Mute button mutes the monitor jack... NOT THE MICROPHONE. If it's plugged in, this mic is 'HOT'.It's really crazy that that icon is on there, as there is basically NO WAY to mute the mic. Crazier still, the documentation confirms that the intended purpose of that button is to mute the monitor jack (which is in and of itself a bizarre design decision as far as I'm concerned). Had to knock off a full star for that and will probably end up returning this mic because of it. A huge part of the reason I even checked this mic out as opposed to other similar dynamic mics in the same price range was that it had a hardware mute button, which I absolutely require. Truly a shame because other than that I really liked it.So...if HW control of mic gain and mute isn't a big deal to you, I would say for the $100 price sound, size, and build quality wise this mic is a decent choice, but if you need those controls or just don't like knowing there's some kind of disconnect between CADs engineers and designers, might want to keep looking. Please try again later.Robert4.0 out of 5 stars Works great - with some tweaking Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2021Style: PodMaster D USBVerified Purchase I'm using the heck out of this mic! It's a great buy. It sounds warm and delightful, and it's not terribly sensitive to plosives. Plug it in and it works.Kind of.If you're using it on Windows 10, the output is VERY low. Low enough that you'll want to crank the Volume control on the mic and boost it in your recording software just to get an audible signal. Unfortunately, that will raise a TON of noise.You'll need to download a preamp app to get a signal out of it you can work with. The good news is you can find good free preamp apps, and once you set them they just WORK, no matter what other apps you're running to record. The bad news is you'll have to play around with it until you achieve a balance between the mic's Volume control and the gain controls in the preamp software to get a clean signal. That took me quite a lot of time.TL;DR: It's a great mic, but it is most definitely NOT plug and play. Reviewed in Mexico on January 29, 2022Style: u29Verified Purchase CAD me parece muy buena compañia para aquellos que buscan una buena relación costo-beneficio en lo que se refiere a microfonía especificamente. Tiene muy buenos productos a precio adecuado. Este modelo CAD u29 lo compré porque necesitaba ( y todavái necesito) un micro USB condensador que me facilitara un poco la vida y tuviera buena calidad de sonido.El micro tiene una construcción aceptable. el cuerpo es metalico pero delgado. La malla también metálica. El cable usb mide 1.5 metros y no trae perilla de volumen ni entrada para audifonos ni cosa por el estilo.El envío fue rápido usando membresía prime pero.... no sé cuando amazón decidió que una bolsa de plastico basta para embalar y proteger un producto como este que en cierto modo es de manejo delicado. Tache en ese aspecto.Con respecto al micro la caja en la que venía se encontraba perforada por un lado aunque realmente no afectó el contenido.Desde que conecté el micro me di cuenta que había un hiss más fuerte de lo común al momento de grabar voz. Trate de corregirlo por todos los medios pero nunca lo logré. Es cierto que se puede utilizar algún plugin para eliminar ese hiss, pero no me convenció. Un buen micro tiene que dar un sonido limpio. Sobre todo si lo vas a usar para podcast como era mi caso. Gastar tiempo en limpiar sonido no conviene. Es un micro que podría servir para video conferencia, clases virtuales y cosas así pero no para grabación de voz donde la calidad es básica. Terminé devolviéndolo. No sé si por la manera de venir embalado en una bolsa de plástico se daño o que pasó. Me parece raro que CAD haya dejado un producto con ese detalle. En fín esa fue mi experiencia. Como ya mencioné en caso de grabación de voz no lo recomendaría. Para cualquier otro uso me parece que tiene la calidad suficiente. Realmente capta muy bien la voz. Da un sonido claro. Pero el hiss que produce es lo que no me gustó para el uso que yo le quería dar. Read more Matteos 4.0 out of 5 stars muy buen micrófono pero.... Este modelo CAD u29 lo compré porque necesitaba ( y todavái necesito) un micro USB condensador que me facilitara un poco la vida y tuviera buena calidad de sonido.El micro tiene una construcción aceptable. el cuerpo es metalico pero delgado. La malla también metálica. El cable usb mide 1.5 metros y no trae perilla de volumen ni entrada para audifonos ni cosa por el estilo.El envío fue rápido usando membresía prime pero.... no sé cuando amazón decidió que una bolsa de plastico basta para embalar y proteger un producto como este que en cierto modo es de manejo delicado. Tache en ese aspecto.Con respecto al micro la caja en la que venía se encontraba perforada por un lado aunque realmente no afectó el contenido.Desde que conecté el micro me di cuenta que había un hiss más fuerte de lo común al momento de grabar voz. Trate de corregirlo por todos los medios pero nunca lo logré. Es cierto que se puede utilizar algún plugin para eliminar ese hiss, pero no me convenció. Un buen micro tiene que dar un sonido limpio. Sobre todo si lo vas a usar para podcast como era mi caso. Gastar tiempo en limpiar sonido no conviene. Es un micro que podría servir para video conferencia, clases virtuales y cosas así pero no para grabación de voz donde la calidad es básica. Terminé devolviéndolo. No sé si por la manera de venir embalado en una bolsa de plástico se daño o que pasó. Me parece raro que CAD haya dejado un producto con ese detalle. En fín esa fue mi experiencia. Como ya mencioné en caso de grabación de voz no lo recomendaría. Para cualquier otro uso me parece que tiene la calidad suficiente. Realmente capta muy bien la voz. Da un sonido claro. Pero el hiss que produce es lo que no me gustó para el uso que yo le quería dar. Read more Matteos 4.0 out of 5 stars muy buen micrófono pero....             3.0 out of 5 stars
            
                Great Sound. Confusing controls
            
            
            
                
                    
                        Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022
                    
                    
                
            
        
        
            I was looking for a relatively inexpensive dynamic mic with hardware mute and gain controls with a nice rich Podcast/Radio sound to it.  This mic definitely delivered the later.  Gain seems good and the sound quality was pretty much spot on to what I was looking for.  The controls however...BE AWARE: Despite what the icons on the side of the mic would suggest, the up/down buttons control system volume, ostensibly for controlling the volume for the built in monitor jack, and worse, despite the icon of a crossed out microphone, the Mute button mutes the monitor jack... NOT THE MICROPHONE. If it's plugged in, this mic is 'HOT'.It's really crazy that that icon is on there, as there is basically NO WAY to mute the mic.  Crazier still, the documentation confirms that the intended purpose of that button is to mute the monitor jack (which is in and of itself a bizarre design decision as far as I'm concerned). Had to knock off a full star for that and will probably end up returning this mic because of it.  A huge part of the reason I even checked this mic out as opposed to other similar dynamic mics in the same price range was that it had a hardware mute button, which I absolutely require.  Truly a shame because other than that I really liked it.So...if HW control of mic gain and mute isn't a big deal to you, I would say for the $100 price sound, size, and build quality wise this mic is a decent choice, but if you need those controls or just don't like knowing there's some kind of disconnect between CADs engineers and designers, might want to keep looking.

Please try again later.Robert4.0 out of 5 stars Works great - with some tweaking Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2021Style: PodMaster D USBVerified Purchase I'm using the heck out of this mic! It's a great buy. It sounds warm and delightful, and it's not terribly sensitive to plosives. Plug it in and it works.Kind of.If you're using it on Windows 10, the output is VERY low. Low enough that you'll want to crank the Volume control on the mic and boost it in your recording software just to get an audible signal. Unfortunately, that will raise a TON of noise.You'll need to download a preamp app to get a signal out of it you can work with. The good news is you can find good free preamp apps, and once you set them they just WORK, no matter what other apps you're running to record. The bad news is you'll have to play around with it until you achieve a balance between the mic's Volume control and the gain controls in the preamp software to get a clean signal. That took me quite a lot of time.TL;DR: It's a great mic, but it is most definitely NOT plug and play. I am using it connected to my laptop to broadcast the voices of a condo board made up of 5 people for hybrid Zoom meetings. Without moving the mike, all 5 are picked up clearly. I highly recommend this if you are looking for an inexpensive solution to hybrid meetings. Please try again later.Robert4.0 out of 5 stars Works great - with some tweaking Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2021Style: PodMaster D USBVerified Purchase I'm using the heck out of this mic! It's a great buy. It sounds warm and delightful, and it's not terribly sensitive to plosives. Plug it in and it works.Kind of.If you're using it on Windows 10, the output is VERY low. Low enough that you'll want to crank the Volume control on the mic and boost it in your recording software just to get an audible signal. Unfortunately, that will raise a TON of noise.You'll need to download a preamp app to get a signal out of it you can work with. The good news is you can find good free preamp apps, and once you set them they just WORK, no matter what other apps you're running to record. The bad news is you'll have to play around with it until you achieve a balance between the mic's Volume control and the gain controls in the preamp software to get a clean signal. That took me quite a lot of time.TL;DR: It's a great mic, but it is most definitely NOT plug and play. Read more 2 people found this helpful Helpful Report abuse Damaris Jue3.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound. Confusing controls Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022Style: PodMaster SuperD USBVerified Purchase I was looking for a relatively inexpensive dynamic mic with hardware mute and gain controls with a nice rich Podcast/Radio sound to it. This mic definitely delivered the later. Gain seems good and the sound quality was pretty much spot on to what I was looking for. The controls however...BE AWARE: Despite what the icons on the side of the mic would suggest, the up/down buttons control system volume, ostensibly for controlling the volume for the built in monitor jack, and worse, despite the icon of a crossed out microphone, the Mute button mutes the monitor jack... NOT THE MICROPHONE. If it's plugged in, this mic is 'HOT'.It's really crazy that that icon is on there, as there is basically NO WAY to mute the mic. Crazier still, the documentation confirms that the intended purpose of that button is to mute the monitor jack (which is in and of itself a bizarre design decision as far as I'm concerned). Had to knock off a full star for that and will probably end up returning this mic because of it. A huge part of the reason I even checked this mic out as opposed to other similar dynamic mics in the same price range was that it had a hardware mute button, which I absolutely require. Truly a shame because other than that I really liked it.So...if HW control of mic gain and mute isn't a big deal to you, I would say for the $100 price sound, size, and build quality wise this mic is a decent choice, but if you need those controls or just don't like knowing there's some kind of disconnect between CADs engineers and designers, might want to keep looking. Read more Damaris Jue 3.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound. Unfortunately, that will raise a TON of noise.You'll need to download a preamp app to get a signal out of it you can work with. The good news is you can find good free preamp apps, and once you set them they just WORK, no matter what other apps you're running to record. The bad news is you'll have to play around with it until you achieve a balance between the mic's Volume control and the gain controls in the preamp software to get a clean signal. Damaris Jue3.0 out of 5 stars Great Sound. Confusing controls Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022Style: PodMaster SuperD USBVerified Purchase I was looking for a relatively inexpensive dynamic mic with hardware mute and gain controls with a nice rich Podcast/Radio sound to it. This mic definitely delivered the later. Gain seems good and the sound quality was pretty much spot on to what I was looking for. The controls however...BE AWARE: Despite what the icons on the side of the mic would suggest, the up/down buttons control system volume, ostensibly for controlling the volume for the built in monitor jack, and worse, despite the icon of a crossed out microphone, the Mute button mutes the monitor jack... NOT THE MICROPHONE. If it's plugged in, this mic is 'HOT'.It's really crazy that that icon is on there, as there is basically NO WAY to mute the mic. Crazier still, the documentation confirms that the intended purpose of that button is to mute the monitor jack (which is in and of itself a bizarre design decision as far as I'm concerned). Had to knock off a full star for that and will probably end up returning this mic because of it. A huge part of the reason I even checked this mic out as opposed to other similar dynamic mics in the same price range was that it had a hardware mute button, which I absolutely require. Truly a shame because other than that I really liked it.So...if HW control of mic gain and mute isn't a big deal to you, I would say for the $100 price sound, size, and build quality wise this mic is a decent choice, but if you need those controls or just don't like knowing there's some kind of disconnect between CADs engineers and designers, might want to keep looking. data.text: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2022

I was looking for a relatively inexpensive dynamic mic with hardware mute and gain controls with a nice rich Podcast/Radio sound to it.  This mic definitely delivered the later.  Gain seems good and the sound quality was pretty much spot on to what I was looking for.  The controls however...BE AWARE: Despite what the icons on the side of the mic would suggest, the up/down buttons control system volume, ostensibly for controlling the volume for the built in monitor jack, and worse, despite the icon of a crossed out microphone, the Mute button mutes the monitor jack... NOT THE MICROPHONE. If it's plugged in, this mic is 'HOT'.It's really crazy that that icon is on there, as there is basically NO WAY to mute the mic.  Crazier still, the documentation confirms that the intended purpose of that button is to mute the monitor jack (which is in and of itself a bizarre design decision as far as I'm concerned). Had to knock off a full star for that and will probably end up returning this mic because of it.  A huge part of the reason I even checked this mic out as opposed to other similar dynamic mics in the same price range was that it had a hardware mute button, which I absolutely require.  Truly a shame because other than that I really liked it.So...if HW control of mic gain and mute isn't a big deal to you, I would say for the $100 price sound, size, and build quality wise this mic is a decent choice, but if you need those controls or just don't like knowing there's some kind of disconnect between CADs engineers and designers, might want to keep looking.

The resulting recording has a high positive offset in the audio waveform. This is my second purchase of this microphone. My first microphone performed as advertised with negligible offset. The second microphone sounds okay but the DC offset is horrible and requires remediation with my DAW to allow its release to my customers. Read more Helpful Report abuse

Top reviews from other countries Translate all reviews to English Carter4.0 out of 5 stars A pretty good mic Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 28, 2021Style: u29Verified Purchase This is a pretty good mic. The cardioid pattern means it basically just picks up what's in front of it and the frequency range is nice and wide. Very easy to setup - it was just 'plug and play' into an iMac, nothing to install - just select the 'CAD mic' in your app audio preferences. Only minus point is the tripod, which doesn't have a height adjustment. Read more Report abuse Matteos4.0 out of 5 stars muy buen micrófono pero.... Reviewed in Mexico on January 29, 2022Style: u29Verified Purchase CAD me parece muy buena compañia para aquellos que buscan una buena relación costo-beneficio en lo que se refiere a microfonía especificamente. Tiene muy buenos productos a precio adecuado. Este modelo CAD u29 lo compré porque necesitaba ( y todavái necesito) un micro USB condensador que me facilitara un poco la vida y tuviera buena calidad de sonido.El micro tiene una construcción aceptable. el cuerpo es metalico pero delgado. La malla también metálica. El cable usb mide 1.5 metros y no trae perilla de volumen ni entrada para audifonos ni cosa por el estilo.El envío fue rápido usando membresía prime pero.... no sé cuando amazón decidió que una bolsa de plastico basta para embalar y proteger un producto como este que en cierto modo es de manejo delicado. Tache en ese aspecto.Con respecto al micro la caja en la que venía se encontraba perforada por un lado aunque realmente no afectó el contenido.Desde que conecté el micro me di cuenta que había un hiss más fuerte de lo común al momento de grabar voz. Trate de corregirlo por todos los medios pero nunca lo logré. Es cierto que se puede utilizar algún plugin para eliminar ese hiss, pero no me convenció. Un buen micro tiene que dar un sonido limpio. Sobre todo si lo vas a usar para podcast como era mi caso. Gastar tiempo en limpiar sonido no conviene. Es un micro que podría servir para video conferencia, clases virtuales y cosas así pero no para grabación de voz donde la calidad es básica. Terminé devolviéndolo. No sé si por la manera de venir embalado en una bolsa de plástico se daño o que pasó. Me parece raro que CAD haya dejado un producto con ese detalle. En fín esa fue mi experiencia. Como ya mencioné en caso de grabación de voz no lo recomendaría. Para cualquier otro uso me parece que tiene la calidad suficiente. Realmente capta muy bien la voz. Da un sonido claro. Pero el hiss que produce es lo que no me gustó para el uso que yo le quería dar. Read more Matteos 4.0 out of 5 stars muy buen micrófono pero.... Es un micro que podría servir para video conferencia, clases virtuales y cosas así pero no para grabación de voz donde la calidad es básica. Terminé devolviéndolo. No sé si por la manera de venir embalado en una bolsa de plástico se daño o que pasó. Me parece raro que CAD haya dejado un producto con ese detalle. En fín esa fue mi experiencia. La malla también metálica. El cable usb mide 1.5 metros y no trae perilla de volumen ni entrada para audifonos ni cosa por el estilo.El envío fue rápido usando membresía prime pero.... no sé cuando amazón decidió que una bolsa de plastico basta para embalar  y proteger un producto como este que en cierto modo es de manejo delicado. Camille H.4.0 out of 5 stars Bon micro Reviewed in France on July 8, 2021Style: u29Verified Purchase Il n'est précisé nul part, mais il faut un tournevis pour le trépied qui permet de le changer de position. (J'ai cherché pendant une heure comment faire si ça peut vous faire gagner du temps)Sinon le micro est bon, bon rapport qualité / prix. Pour un vocal sur discord rien à redire, performant et on m'entend bien. Le petit trépied est super !J'enregistre sur Audacity et on entend un léger bruit de fond, qui peut être gênant suivant votre utilisation.Sinon globalement vu le petit prix c'est un très bon micro pour les débutants sur Audacity ou ceux qui veulent seulement l'utiliser en vocal.
